cab.content: Secret.This Document is the Property ofHis Britannic f985n Governmenti245From, Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of Slate for India,8lh July im. (Received 9th.)9218. 8th July. Malleson M..D. 01871, dated 6th July addressed to Simla, repeated to Constantinople and Tehran : " Ivly telegram of 25th ultimo. Situation in Trans-Caspia, A wire dated 3rd July received from DjunkoVski and Burkov, states that line was cut in several places west of Kaahka. All guns and munitions of war had to be abandoned by Trans-Caspian troops. Presumably 400 cossacks remaining at front. Trans-Caspian troops are destroying whole of line east of Askabad. Whole of Government except Djunkovski and Burkov fled to Krasnovodsk. Djunkovski is in control of Askabad where there has been no bloodshed. Railway working to Krasnovodsk."
